result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Letter from defendant to MRR re: Drug Court

1:51 PM Defendant Jacob P. Hetue appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Public defender needs more time to appoint counsel.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Court tolls time limits. 
Prelim Hrg reset:
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.

1:37 pm - Defendant Jacob P. Hetue appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Public defender needs more time to appoint counsel.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Court tolls time limits.
Prelim adj. to 10-26-22 at 1:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.
Preliminary hearing on October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:46 PM Defendant Jacob P. Hetue appeared by video, in custody. Special appearance by Attorney Heather M Faeh in court for Jacob P. Hetue.  Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant in custody.    
Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 10-03-22 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Re:  Possess Methamphetamine with Intent to Deliver, 2nd & subsequent offense, on 08-29-22.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of PWI Methamphetamine while armed, keeper of drug house, and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 09-26-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 cash bond with the conditions that defendant is to have no contact with any known drug users, defendant is not to possess or use any controlled substances, and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.
Minutes.
